meanings.definition: To mark off the limits of
meanings.sent1: She circumscribed the boundaries of the map with a thick black line.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor circumscribed the property with small flags.

meanings.definition: To restrict or limit in range or scope
meanings.sent1: The new law circumscribed the rights of the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The company policy circumscribed the use of personal devices at work.
meanings.sent3: The diet circumscribed her food choices, leaving her craving sweets.
meanings.sent4: His fear circumscribed his adventures, always staying close to home.
meanings.sent5: The storm circumscribed their travel plans, forcing them to stay indoors.
